Text.Page: Hey! Do you have some time to answer a few questions?
Thanks. A lot of soldiers don't give civilians the time of day. I just want to know what's going on.<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"How can I help?"</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>
When the argons hit us, we feared for Kaiator. Did they sack it?<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"No, Kaiator still stands."</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

What a relief. Without access to Kaiator, we'd never survive. We haven't gotten any supply shipments in weeks. We're holding out, but the villagers fear a painful death from starvation.<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"We'll get supply flights going again."</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

Thanks. Blasted argons don't appreciate the need for regular meals and firewhiskey.

They're definitely storing something, though. We've seen the big argons transporting these glowing...things to the Cyasma Spire."What's in this spire?"
No one knows, but I heard Celtan mention that cyasma is like argon blood and food—all in one.<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"We've suspected as much."</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

We're not cowards, but we can't hurt the argons. Most of us are simple artisans or traders.

We're no match for these red argons—or their queen."Did you say queen?"

Yes. Ceidos called her "Shandra Manaya." I don't know where he heard it from.

All I know is we started seeing these red argons—and they're a lot stronger than the blue ones. If you fight them, watch yourself.
